column1: # Readings for 1880-1882 are for the Patrington Flax Mill site, and have been omitted.
# The December 1945 reading is shown in brackets (at the point where the observer changes) but has been retained (as has the total).
# The site is Rose Cottage on Humber Lane in Patrington village.
# The gauge was at Patrington Flax Mill (where the observer W.B.Pugh worked) until the end of 1882.
# A new gauge was used from April 1920.
# In the mid 1940s the gauge moved 700yds NW to Station Road. The date of the move is a bit ambiguous.
# The move was probably in December 1945, but the note could be read as it being in April 1947.
# British Rainfall 1911 has a page on William Buckley Pugh, and his exchanges with Symons.
# In parallel with his Patrington records, he also maintained a long record at Newtown Dolfor in Montgomeryshire.
